channel.title: Angle between 3 points
channel.description:
I have 3 points, it makes a triangle.
(0, 0) -> (12, 2) -> (3, 2)
I need to work out the angle at (12, 2).
so far I tried the cosine rule, however it doesn't produce the right answer here are my workings:
a = sqrt((0-12)^2 + (0-2)^2) = sqrt(144 + 4) = 12.165525060596439 b = sqrt((12-3)^2 + (2-2)^2) = sqrt(81 + 0) = 9.0 c = sqrt((3 - 0)^2 + (2-0)^2) = sqrt(9 + 4) = 3.605551275463989
-2 * a * c = -87.72684879784522 b^2 - a^2 - c^2 = -79.99999999999997 0.42285392613294126 raidens or 24.227745317954202 degrees
when that is wrong... Im probably doing something stupid but im tired and cant work it out :( needs to be done soon as well
thanks in advance

item.title: Angle between 3 points
item.dc:creator: @angel_in_war angel in war
item.description:
@angel_in_war wrote:

Point(x1, y1)
Point(x2, y2)
Point(x3, y3)

a = square root((x1 - x2)^2 + (y1 - y2)^2)
b = square root((x2 - x3)^2 + (y2 - y3)^2)
c = square root((x1 - x3)^2 + (y1 - y3)^2)

then using Heron’s formula
A = 0.25*square root((a^2 + b^2 + c^2)^2 - 2(a^4 + b^4 +c^4))

then just find the angle you’re looking for by using
triangle area rule (a * b * sin (the angle in between the two lines)
A = 0.5(ab sin ABC)

Read full topic

item.title: Angle between 3 points
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:4, topic:378976”]You’re right Ollie:
The Angle CAB is 24.3 degrees.
You’re right Echo_:
The Angle CBA is 9.462322 degrees
And the last one can only be one thing.
The Angle BAC is 146.31 degrees.
(Checked with a Graph program)[/quote]

Huh? Aren’t angles CAB and BAC the same thing? I think you mean angle BCA for the last one.

Read full topic

item.title: Angle between 3 points
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

atan(y) = returns the angle x

atan2(x, y) = returns the angle between the x-axis and the x y coordinates

Read full topic

item.title: Angle between 3 points
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

yes,

double x_difference = this.next.getX() - this.current.getX(); double y_difference = this.next.getY() - this.current.getY(); angle = previousAngle - (previousAngle = Math.atan2(y_difference, x_difference)); angle = Math.toDegrees(angle);

Read full topic

item.title: Angle between 3 points
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

We solved it on the IRC using atan2, or atan(2/12) appx = .165 radians, or 9.46 degrees.

item.title: Angle between 3 points
item.dc:creator: @Echo3 Echo_
item.description:
@Echo3 wrote:

A is (0, 0), B is (12, 2), and C is (3, 2). Side c is 12.165525 units, side b is 3.6055512 units, and side a is 9 units. Now you use SSS to find angle B:

b² = a² + c² - 2ac cosB
(3.6055512)² = (9)² + (12.165525)² - 2 (9) (12.165525) cosB
(12.99999946) = (81) + (147.9999985) - (218.97945) cosB
(12.99999946) = (10.0205485) cosB

10.0205485 10.0205485

1.297334119 = cosB
9.462322° = B

Read full topic

I have 3 points, it makes a triangle.

so far I tried the cosine rule, however it doesn’t produce the right answer here are my workings:

b = sqrt((12-3)^2 + (2-2)^2) = sqrt(81 + 0) = 9.0
c = sqrt((3 - 0)^2 + (2-0)^2) = sqrt(9 + 4) = 3.605551275463989

b^2 - a^2 - c^2 = -79.99999999999997
